message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

This paper deals with the problem of motion transfer for generating person videos, which involves computer vision (CV) and machine learning (ML) techniques. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a spatio-temporal attention mechanism, which involves modeling the temporal dynamics of the video, and hence, it could also be categorized under cs.MM (Multimedia). The paper also uses a discriminator to evaluate the generated videos, which is a common technique in Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), and hence, it could be categorized under cs.GR (Graphics). The paper also involves training a deep neural network, which is a common technique in ML, and hence, it could be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper proposes a flexible background substitution application, which involves image processing and manipulation, and hence, it could be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
